meanings.definition: A person or thing that has no chance of success.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant in that location was a nonstarter from the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The idea of flying without wings is a clear nonstarter.
meanings.sent3: Trying to swim in a desert is as much of a nonstarter as trying to fly without wings.
meanings.sent4: His plan to become a professional basketball player was a nonstarter, considering his height.
meanings.sent5: Asking a fish to climb a tree is as futile as expecting that project to succeed - a true nonstarter.

meanings.definition: Something that fails to start or begin.
meanings.sent1: The broken car was a nonstarter this morning.
meanings.sent2: The nonstarter of the engine delayed our trip.
meanings.sent3: The nonstarter of the party was when the music system broke down.
meanings.sent4: The nonstarter of the race was the unexpected storm that hit the area.
meanings.sent5: The nonstarter of the project was the lack of funding, halting progress before it even began.
